sub_title: Senior Product Owner at Thermo Fisher Scientific
summary: I am motivated by a challenging task that enables my creative thinking and my skills to engineer innovative solutions. I enjoy working with and for people. I have strong powers of empathy and ability to create bonds within teams. I am also eager to learn from those experienced and to engage in training roles. I hold two Ph.D. degrees, one in mechanical engineering and another in electrical engineering. My multidisciplinary domain covers software development, simulation (CAE/CAD), numerical methods, physics, and biology.

projects.title: Electrical characterization of thin films of MO3
projects.description: Design, construction and testing of a measurement device for the electrical characterization of thin films of MO3. The tasks included the fabrication of thin films using physical vapour deposition (PVD), and the design in LabVIEW of an user-friendly interface for controlling the device and display (evaluate) results.

authors.headline: Senior Product Owner at Thermo Fisher Scientific

profile_positions.description: I acted as the voice of the customer for two Scrum teams. As Product Owner, I was accountable for the JIRA Product Backlog and its Lean-Agile execution based on value for the customers and the company. With the implementation of SAFe as framework for the Way of Working across teams, it was my duty to align with stakeholders (Business Owners, Program Managers, Chief Product Owners) on why a task needs to be executed by my team and what exactly does that entitle for them. I also took care of defining enabler features, which add value by enhancing and enabling the architectural runaway on which the team operates.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description: I provided direction, instructions and guidance to a team of design engineers. As sub-function architect, I took design decisions and made sure that the team progress went about technically sound requirements and specifications. As team leader, I kept the team roadmap updated, maintained a close and open communication with the team to steer their daily activities, organiced regular meetings to review progress, and maintained  properly informed and involved all stakeholders to ensure that the team deliverables met their expectations.
profile_positions.title: Sub-Function Architect/Team Lead

profile_positions.description: I worked in the design and implementation of software-based tools for the Metrology Department.  These tools, initially oriented to reduce the workload and increase the efficiency in solving requests from the customer site,  were integrated into software suits to be purchased and used directly by ASML customers worldwide.  Therefore, not only performance and quality of the solutions were important, but also the need to meet customer expectations and good practices related to the software release, which included flexible architecture,  modular coding, smooth integration, proper testing, and maintenance. Being directly involved in the complete life cycle of a software product, I gained experience in project management, communication and negotiation with stakeholders, and the development of new SW products.
profile_positions.title: Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: Bright Society is a talent incubator, facilitating young Bright people to boost their early career. During a 3-year program these young academics, all with a PhD degree, discover their passion and talent. Through intensive guidance, facing challenges in a variety of companies they experience true inspiration.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description:
I investigated from a numerical standpoint the possible interaction mechanisms
between electric fields and biological cells. I concluded on the dosimetry metrics
needed to induce plausible interactions, the attributes of the cells for this to occur, the
beneficial effects of using electrostimulation to enhance biological responses, and the
exposure level that induces thermal damage.
Electromagnetics group. Promotor: Prof. dr. ir. Peter Zwamborn.
Keywords: Fortran, electromagnetics, numerical methods, integral equations, transport equations, heat coupling, cell biology, bioelectricity.
profile_positions.title: PhD in Electrical Engineering - Bioelectromagnetics

profile_positions.description:
I investigated the influence of electrostimulation during bone formation around a
dental implant. I concluded on the benefits and limitations of using electrostimulation
to improve bone growth and reduce healing time. I proposed a method to quantify the
electrically-induced cell migration (electrotaxis) using a mathematical model.
Mathematical Modeling and Numerical Methods Research Group. Promotor: Prof. dr. ir. Diego Alexander Garzón.
Keywords: FEM, CAE/CAD, reaction-diffusion equations, partial differential equations, electrical stimulation, bone and wound healing, biomaterials.
profile_positions.title: PhD in Mechanical Engineering - Computational biology

profile_positions.description: I performed teaching activities for the bachelor course “Fundamentals of the Finite Elements Method - FEM”. I gave lectures and prepared handouts. I also evaluated the theoretical knowledge and the use of ANSYS.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
I implemented a mathematical model of the bone formation around a dental implant
with(-out) surface irregularities. I quantified via cell cultures the influence of surface
irregularities in the bone formation around a dental implant.
Mathematical Modeling and Numerical Methods Research Group. Supervisor: Prof. dr. ir. Diego Alexander Garzón.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher - Master student

profile_positions.description: Summer Internship Programm 2010. Supervisor: Mark Mirotznik, PhD
profile_positions.title: Research Internship - Modelling SAR profile

profile_positions.location: Ciudad de México y alrededores, México
profile_positions.description: Cellular and Molecular Biology Laboratory. Faculty of Dentistry. Supervisor: Dss. dr. Higinio Arzate
profile_positions.title: Research Internship - Cell cultures

profile_positions.description: I performed teaching activities for the bachelor course "Numerical methods". I gave lectures and prepared handouts. I also evaluated the theoretical knowledge and the implementations in Matlab.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
During the last two years of my bachelor, I worked full time in the design, construction, and testing of a device for the electrical characterization of thin films of MO3. I built an
electromechanical device controlled by a user-friendly interface that displayed and
evaluated the measurements. Using physical vapor deposition (PVD), I fabricated thin
films to evaluate the performance of the setup.
Physics of condensed matter laboratory, Department of Physics. Supervisor: Prof. dr. ir. Jaime Torres.
profile_positions.title: Application Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: Guiding people interested in learning the Spanish language to, depending on the level and knowledge, improve their general skills to communicate in an informal setting.
